(report_single_mod):  If a file has only propchanges, do *not* stash
it in the postfix-file-batons hash.    If you delete something, do
*not* stash it in the postfix-file-batons hash.  If you add a
directory, do *not* stash it in the postfix-file-batons hash.
These things have been Wrong for a long time, but we never saw the
bugs until the previous change was made.  The hash has a narrow

author: kfogel
msg: Finish up "svn log" command line parsing, make repository log looping
work right, make sure it all works over ra_local.

tests, and better date range parsing (though that's not specific to

author: sussman
msg: NOTE:  this commit moves a  file from one directory to another.  This
means re-running autogen.sh, and someone will need to tweak the Win32
copyfrom args during a commit.  Also, if copyfrom args are found on
a directory, do *not* recurse in "adds_only" mode.
(struct edit_baton): rename type of 'hook' field, as per below.
* ra_local.h (svn_ra_local__get_editor):  re-declare here, slightly new name.

author: cmpilato
msg: (upd_delete_entry): Doh!  If you're gonna XML-escape a path name,
you might as well use the escaped version.

author: cmpilato
msg: More support for IZ #494 (well, a side of #494 not yet documented in
#494 because our IZ-serving server is not serving right now).
Specifically, we'd like to be able to support XML-unsafe paths.
(send_response, dav_svn__merge_response): XML-escape URLs in the response.
(add_helper): If we go through the trouble of XML-escape the
copy-from URL, we should at least use the escaped version.  :-)
